messages.text: @channel Heads up. Monitoring is screaming on the Frankfurt ingress. Latency on /v1/payments is hitting 2.5s. @marcus_devops you seeing this?
Checking Grafana... Yeah, it's a spike. Also seeing a surge in 502s. Looks like the connection pool to the main DB is saturated. Wait... I'm seeing weird strings in the logs.
Marcus, pull those strings. I just got a WAF alert for SEC-901. Someone is hitting the credit application endpoint with UNION SELECT payloads at the same time the latency spiked.

Attached snippet: `GET /api/v1/apply/credit?id=101' UNION SELECT NULL,NULL,NULL--`. @elena_security, looks like the SQLi attempt is forcing a full table scan and locking rows, which is causing the PAY-101 latency for legit users.
Okay, tactical plan: 1. Blacklist Source IP 192.168.44.11 at the edge. 2. Scale the payment-service pods to 5 replicas to handle the backlog. 3. @elena_security please update the WAF rules.
IP 192.168.44.11 is null-routed. Latency starting to drop. I'll update the JIRA tickets with the Trace IDs.
